column4: Ubuntu 8.04 Live CD.  Pretty thing.  I will be interfacing with a Vista system tomorrow.
I would like to boot with the Ubuntu Live CD and do a dd of a FAT32 drive into a file on the Vista system.  Vista's NTFS.
Is that risky? should I be looking for a Windows solution for the dd?
as long as ntfs is big enough also due to limitations of ntfs-3g it may take quite some time
